This is an [R Markdown](http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com) Notebook. Traveling the universe of Bayesian statistics. 

```{r, echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
library(bayesplot)
library(bayestestR)
library(bayesutils)
library(BayesFactor)
library(rstanarm)
library(insight)
library(tidyverse)
```
```{r}
model <- stan_glm(bsalary ~., data = bank_salary, chains = 2, iter = 10000, warmup = 5000)
posteriors <- get_parameters(model)
desc <- describe_posterior(model)
print(desc)
head(get_parameters(model))
nrow(get_parameters(model))

ggplot(posteriors, aes(x = male)) +
  geom_density(fill = 'purple')
```



The plot
```{r}
ggplot(posteriors, aes(x = male)) +
  geom_density(fill = "purple") +
  # The mean in blue
  geom_vline(xintercept = mean(posteriors$male), 
             color = "blue", size = 1) +
  # The median in red
  geom_vline(xintercept = median(posteriors$male), 
             color = "red", size = 1) +
  # The MAP in purple
  geom_vline(xintercept = map_estimate(posteriors$male), 
             color = "orange", size = 1)
```
